Feature and power packed compact SUV Mahindra XUV 3XO review - Feature and power packed compact SUV Out goes the Mahindra XUV300 and in comes the XUV 3XO. The new name is just the starting point of a very comprehensive upgrade. Updated on May 02, 2024 05:35:55 PM 87,049 Views Follow us on The XUV 3XO's styling is big on flash The diamond-shaped detailing on the lights and grille are a nice touch. The infotainment is now a 10.25-inch unit and works well. By Nikhil Bhatia Share - Make : Mahindra Model : XUV 3XO We Like Upmarket interior Strong engines Long equipment list We Don't Like Boot space Competent as the Mahindra XUV300 was, it never quite made it to the list of compact SUV bestsellers. Mahindra is now gunning for glory with the updated XUV300, christened the XUV 3XO. Mind you, this is no run-of-the-mill nip and tuck update. Mahindra has gone all out with a new look, redone interior, some class-first feature introductions, some class-best specifications and very enticing pricing. The aim is to take the fight to the Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza, Kia Sonet and Hyundai Venue, and win. Mahindra XUV 3XO: design and styling Where the XUV300s styling was understated, the XUV 3XO is big on flash. Giving the 3XO its distinctive face are the large, new vertically oriented headlights outlined by C-shaped DRLs (a link to the larger XUV700). The headlights are split into two sections with a concealed projector unit up top, and an open projector fog lamp unit lower down, both set amidst a black surround. The lights flank the new grille, which is actually a gloss panel that runs much of the XUVs width. The new front bumper with its pronounced cuts and creases is very concept car-like and the newly contoured bonnet also does its bit to add volume to the design. New C-shaped LED DRLs provide a visual link with the larger XUV700. Like the XUV300, the 3XO looks muscular in profile, and furthering the impression are the stylish new 17-inch diamond cut alloy wheels that are the largest in the segment. Theres also chunkier side cladding with cuts at the wheel arches. Mahindra says ground clearance is a generous 201mm, up from the XUV300s figure of 180mm. Mahindra XUV 3XO Price, Mileage, Specifications, Features and Variants Brand Mahindra Model Name XUV 3XO Mahindra XUV 3XO Price 9.06 - 18.39 lakh Mahindra XUV 3XO Range/Mileage Petrol : 17.96 - 20.1kpl | Diesel : 20.6 - 21.2kpl Mahindra XUV 3XO Specifications SUV | 5 doors | 5 seats View All Specs Mahindra XUV 3XO Features LED headlight | 10.25-inch Touchscreen display | 6 airbags View All Features Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants MX1 1.2 Petrol MT | REVX M 1.2 Petrol MT | REVX M (O) 1.2 Petrol MT View All Variants In its basic shape though, the 3XO is no different than the XUV300. The 2,600mm wheelbase remains class best, but the short overhangs, particularly at the back, tell you that this is a vehicle that's brutally shortened (remember it started life as a SsangYong Tivoli) to get length under the critical 4m mark, needed to qualify as a small car and hence a lower rate of tax. New 17-inch alloys are the largest in the segment. Overview Price Variants Mileage Specs Offers Colours Images More Mahindra XUV 3XO Gets A New REVX Variant Lineup, Makes A Crowd-favourite Feature More Accessible! Published July 8, 2025 Views : 1117 3 min read By Yashein Kewalramani Follow us Too confused between AX and MX variants, the new REVX lineup might just be the solution! Quick Highlights Mahindra XUV 3XO REVX range launched from Rs 8.94 lakh (ex-showroom) Sports a body-coloured grille, black wheels, black leatherette seats and REVX badging Makes certain premium features like panoramic sunroof more accessible REVX M variants are positioned between the MX2 and MX2 Pro trims REVX A trims are positioned between the AX5 and AX5 L variants The REVX M comes with the entry-level MPFI engine, while the REVX A gets the TGDi engine Mahindra has just introduced a new range of variants for the XUV 3XO , called the REVX. The REVX range further branches into three variants, called the REVX M, REVX M (O) and REVX A. These variants basically add minor styling tweaks and make the premium top-end features more accessible, giving buyers more value for money. Heres a look at their pricing: Variant Price (ex-showroom) REVX M MPFI Manual Rs 8.94 lakh REVX M (O) MPFI Petrol Manual Rs 9.44 lakh REVX A TGDi Petrol Manual Rs 11.79 lakh REVX A TGDi Petrol Automatic Rs 12.99 lakh REVX M And M (O) The REVX M trim is essentially positioned between the MX2 and MX2 Pro trims, while the M (O) adds a crowd-favourite feature. The REVX version of the XUV 3XO gets REVX badging on the outside, black wheels and a body-coloured grille. The REVX M comes with black leatherette seats, which are otherwise available only with the AX7 variants. You get black wheel covers, a 10.25-inch infotainment, 4 speakers, steering-mounted audio controls, keyless entry, and height-adjustable driver seats. The REVX M (O) further introduces a single-pane sunroof. Both variants can be had only with the entry-level 1.2-litre MPFI engine, which makes 111 PS and 200 Nm, and can be opted for only with a 6-speed manual transmission. It misses out on the diesel option and the convenience of an automatic unit. REVX A The REVX A sits between the AX5 and AX5 L trims. Over the AX5 variant, it gets amenities like a panoramic sunroof, black leatherette seats, dual tone roof, black alloy wheels, auto dimming IRVM and body-coloured grille. It misses out on ADAS, a 360-degree camera, EPB with auto hold and a cooled glove box, which the AX5 L offers. Overall, it provides a different appearance with the black alloy wheels, tweaked grille, and black seats inside. Also, it comes with a panoramic sunroof, making the crowd-favourite feature more accessible. Bad news for diesel buyers, as this variant can only be had with the top-spec turbo-petrol engine. The engine here is a 1.2-litre TGDi petrol unit which makes 130 PS and 230 Nm. The good thing is that it can be had with both a 6-speed manual and a 6-speed automatic transmission. The REVX range can be opted for from 6 dual-tone hues: Tango Red, Nebula Blue, Stealth Black, Everest White and Galaxy Grey. Visually, the REVX range also comes with a body-coloured front grille as well, where the Galaxy Grey gets a Stealth Black grille. ZigSays The REVX range provides buyers with what they want! The demand for black seats, black alloy wheels and a sunroof at a more affordable price was always there, and Mahindra has offered that with the new variants. The only thing that could have been better is that Mahindra could have offered the new variants with more powertrain options, especially the REVX M trims. Mahindra XUV 3XO Features Explained: A Comprehensive Guide. Published on 27 Aug, 2024, 9:41 AM IST Updated on 28 Aug, 2024, 5:59 AM IST Team Ackodrive 8 min read Interesting Articles Follow us on Share Post Mahindra recently launched the much-awaited Mahindra XUV 3XO as a compact SUV in the Indian automotive industry. Outperforming its rivals, the Tata Nexon, Hyundai Venue and Maruti Suzuki Brezza, the Mahindra XUV 3XO brings a fresh look to the segment. With the latest updates and comfortable features, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is on the list of must-buy compact SUVs in India. Here, we will take a closer look at the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained and help you choose the ideal car. Contents Price of Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants After the Mahindra XUV 3XO features are explained, you must know the price of each variant. Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP Safety Rating Checking a cars NCAP rating is one of the best ways to understand how safe it is. NCAP, or the New Car Assessment Program, conducts crash tests to see how well a vehicle can protect its occupants in an accident. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has performed well in its NCAP tests. It was tested under Bharat NCAP (BNCAP), which is Indias version of the global safety program. The Mahindra XUV 3XO received a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP, meaning it provides excellent protection for both adults and children. Lets look at the details of the Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP rating. Mahindra XUV 3XO Adult Occupant Protection Rating During the adult occupants rating in the NCAP test, the Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP ratings were pretty impressive. The vehicle scored the maximum possible score of 29.36 out of 32 points . Some crucial factors that contributed to this high rating include: Stable Bodyshell: The structure of the Mahindra XUV 3XO has been found to be stable, meaning it can withstand additional impact without collapsing. Frontal Impact Protection: The cars front airbags and seatbelt pre-tensioners helped reduce injuries to the head, neck, and chest. Side Impact Protection: The side structure of the XUV 3XO, along with additional side and curtain airbags, ensured safety in side collisions. Electronic Stability Control (ESC): This system helps maintain control of the car during sudden turns or slippery conditions, reducing the chances of rollovers. All-Wheel Disc Brakes: The XUV 3XO offers disc brakes on all four wheels, providing better braking efficiency. Mahindra XUV 3XO Child Occupant Protection Rating Child safety is another critical aspect of a cars overall safety rating. The Mahindra XUV 3XO safety rating for child occupants is 43 out of 49 points , which is an excellent score. This means the car provides solid protection for children in case of an accident. Some of the key factors that contributed to this rating include: ISOFIX Child Seat Anchors: These allow parents to securely install child safety seats, reducing the risk of movement in case of impact. final_report.detailed:
Let me think through this: The Mahindra XUV 3XO has made safety a paramount concern in its design and feature set, positioning itself as a strong contender in the compact SUV segment. A comprehensive analysis reveals a multi-faceted approach to safety, encompassing both passive and active safety systems, along with advanced driver-assistance technologies. The XUV 3XO's commitment to safety is validated by its 5-star safety rating from Bharat NCAP, demonstrating its ability to protect occupants in the event of a collision.

**Passive Safety Features:**

Passive safety features are designed to minimize injury during a crash. The XUV 3XO incorporates several key passive safety elements:

*   **6 Airbags:** The XUV 3XO comes standard with up to 6 airbags, including front, side, and curtain airbags. These airbags provide a cushioning effect during a collision, reducing the risk of head, chest, and pelvic injuries. Airbags are strategically positioned to offer comprehensive protection to all occupants.

    *   **Benefits:** Significantly reduces the severity of injuries in frontal and side-impact collisions. Provides crucial head protection, minimizing the risk of trauma.

    *   **Effectiveness:** Airbags are most effective when used in conjunction with seatbelts. Studies have shown that airbags reduce driver fatalities in frontal crashes by approximately 30%.
*   **Robust Built and Structural Integrity:** The vehicle's body structure is designed to absorb and distribute impact forces away from the passenger cabin. High-strength steel is used in critical areas to enhance structural rigidity and crashworthiness.

    *   **Benefits:** Maintains the integrity of the passenger compartment during a collision, preventing intrusion and reducing the risk of injury. Provides a stable foundation for the deployment of other safety systems.

    *   **Effectiveness:** A stable bodyshell is essential for achieving high crash test ratings. It ensures that the airbags and seatbelts can function optimally.
*   **Seatbelt Reminders for All Occupants:** The XUV 3XO includes seatbelt reminders for all seats, prompting occupants to buckle up. This feature helps ensure that all occupants are properly restrained in the event of a crash.

    *   **Benefits:** Increases seatbelt usage, which is the most effective way to prevent serious injuries in a collision.

    *   **Effectiveness:** Seatbelts reduce the risk of fatal injury to front-seat occupants by up to 50% and to rear-seat occupants by up to 25%.

**Active Safety Features:**

Active safety features are designed to prevent accidents from occurring in the first place. The XUV 3XO is equipped with several advanced active safety systems:

*   **Electronic Stability Control (ESC) with Hill Hold Control (HHC):** ESC helps maintain vehicle stability by detecting and reducing skidding. HHC prevents the vehicle from rolling backward on inclines.

    *   **Benefits:** Enhances vehicle control in adverse driving conditions, such as slippery roads or sudden maneuvers. Prevents roll-away accidents on hills.

    *   **Effectiveness:** ESC has been shown to reduce single-vehicle crashes by up to 30%. HHC provides added safety and convenience on steep inclines.
*   **Anti-lock Braking System (ABS) with Electronic Brake-force Distribution (EBD):** ABS prevents the wheels from locking up during braking, allowing the driver to maintain steering control. EBD distributes braking force optimally between the front and rear wheels.

    *   **Benefits:** Improves braking performance and reduces stopping distances, especially on slippery surfaces. Enhances steering control during emergency braking.

    *   **Effectiveness:** ABS has been shown to reduce the risk of crashes by approximately 10%. EBD optimizes braking efficiency, further improving safety.
*   **All-Wheel Disc Brakes:** The XUV 3XO features disc brakes on all four wheels, providing consistent and reliable braking performance.

    *   **Benefits:** Offers superior braking power compared to drum brakes, especially in wet conditions. Reduces brake fade and improves overall braking performance.

    *   **Effectiveness:** Disc brakes provide more consistent and predictable braking performance, enhancing safety in various driving conditions.
*   **Tyre Pressure Monitoring System (TPMS):** TPMS monitors the air pressure in each tire and alerts the driver if the pressure drops below a certain threshold.

    *   **Benefits:** Prevents tire blowouts, improves fuel efficiency, and extends tire life. Enhances vehicle stability and handling.

    *   **Effectiveness:** TPMS helps drivers maintain optimal tire pressure, reducing the risk of accidents caused by underinflated tires.

**Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS):**

The XUV 3XO is equipped with Level 2 ADAS, offering a suite of advanced driver assistance technologies:

*   **Adaptive Cruise Control:** Automatically adjusts the vehicle's speed to maintain a safe distance from the vehicle ahead.

    *   **Benefits:** Reduces driver fatigue on long journeys and helps prevent rear-end collisions.

    *   **Effectiveness:** Adaptive cruise control can significantly reduce the risk of accidents in highway driving.
*   **Lane Keeping Assist:** Detects lane markings and provides steering assistance to help keep the vehicle within its lane.

    *   **Benefits:** Prevents unintentional lane departures and reduces the risk of side-impact collisions.

    *   **Effectiveness:** Lane keeping assist can significantly reduce the risk of lane departure accidents.
*   **Automatic Emergency Braking (AEB):** Detects potential collisions and automatically applies the brakes to mitigate or avoid the impact.

    *   **Benefits:** Reduces the severity of collisions and can prevent accidents altogether.

    *   **Effectiveness:** AEB is one of the most effective ADAS features, significantly reducing the risk of front-to-rear collisions.
*   **Blind Spot Monitoring:** Alerts the driver to the presence of vehicles in their blind spots.

    *   **Benefits:** Prevents lane-change accidents.

    *   **Effectiveness:** Blind spot monitoring enhances awareness of surrounding traffic, minimizing the risk of collisions.

*   **360-Degree Surround View System with Blind View Monitor:** Provides a comprehensive view of the vehicle's surroundings, aiding in parking and low-speed maneuvers.

    *   **Benefits:** Enhances visibility and reduces the risk of collisions in tight spaces.

    *   **Effectiveness:** The 360-degree camera improves driver awareness and reduces the likelihood of parking-related accidents.

**Safety Certifications and Ratings:**

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has earned a 5-star safety rating from Bharat NCAP, which confirms its ability to protect adult and child occupants in a crash. Bharat NCAP subjects vehicles to a series of crash tests, including frontal impact, side impact, and pole impact tests, to evaluate their crashworthiness. The XUV 3XO's 5-star rating demonstrates that it meets the highest safety standards.

**Effectiveness Analysis:**

The effectiveness of the XUV 3XO's safety features has been proven through crash tests and real-world data analysis. The 5-star Bharat NCAP rating indicates that the vehicle provides excellent protection for occupants in a variety of crash scenarios. The ADAS features have also been shown to reduce the risk of accidents in real-world driving conditions. For example, AEB has been shown to reduce front-to-rear collisions by up to 50%.

**Conclusion:**

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a safe and well-equipped compact SUV that prioritizes the safety of its occupants. Its combination of passive and active safety features, along with advanced driver assistance systems, makes it one of the safest vehicles in its class. The 5-star Bharat NCAP rating further validates its commitment to safety. Mahindra has successfully integrated a comprehensive suite of safety technologies into the XUV 3XO, offering a safe and secure driving experience for all occupants.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO safety rating proves that it is one of the safest cars in its segment. Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP Safety Rating Checking a cars NCAP rating is one of the best ways to understand how safe it is. NCAP, or the New Car Assessment Program, conducts crash tests to see how well a vehicle can protect its occupants in an accident. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has performed well in its NCAP tests. It was tested under Bharat NCAP (BNCAP), which is Indias version of the global safety program. The Mahindra XUV 3XO received a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP, meaning it provides excellent protection for both adults and children. Lets look at the details of the Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP rating. Mahindra XUV 3XO Adult Occupant Protection Rating During the adult occupants rating in the NCAP test, the Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP ratings were pretty impressive. The vehicle scored the maximum possible score of 29.36 out of 32 points . Some crucial factors that contributed to this high rating include: Stable Bodyshell: The structure of the Mahindra XUV 3XO has been found to be stable, meaning it can withstand additional impact without collapsing. Frontal Impact Protection: The cars front airbags and seatbelt pre-tensioners helped reduce injuries to the head, neck, and chest. Side Impact Protection: The side structure of the XUV 3XO, along with additional side and curtain airbags, ensured safety in side collisions. Electronic Stability Control (ESC): This system helps maintain control of the car during sudden turns or slippery conditions, reducing the chances of rollovers. All-Wheel Disc Brakes: The XUV 3XO offers disc brakes on all four wheels, providing better braking efficiency. Mahindra XUV 3XO Child Occupant Protection Rating Child safety is another critical aspect of a cars overall safety rating. The Mahindra XUV 3XO safety rating for child occupants is 43 out of 49 points , which is an excellent score. This means the car provides solid protection for children in case of an accident. Some of the key factors that contributed to this rating include: ISOFIX Child Seat Anchors: These allow parents to securely install child safety seats, reducing the risk of movement in case of impact. With the latest updates and comfortable features, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is on the list of must-buy compact SUVs in India. Here, we will take a closer look at the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained and help you choose the ideal car. Contents Price of Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants After the Mahindra XUV 3XO features are explained, you must know the price of each variant. Influencing Exterior Look The Mahindra XUV 3XO has a specific design to turn heads with its athletic stance. It commands respect and exudes the confidence of a true SUV. The all-new Mahindra XUV 3XO has an ample ground clearance of 201 mm, making it easy for you to drive on rocky terrains. In addition, the XUV 3XO comes with a command seating position to offer an exhilarating driving experience. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has LED DRLs and headlamps that will lead the road to envy you whenever you turn them on. Furthermore, the infinity tail lamps add an X factor to your style quotient. The car also features 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels for that sporty look. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Dimensions 2. Comforting Interior When you drive the Mahindra XUV 3XO, it elevates your every journey. Stepping inside the XUV 3XOs cabin will let you discover a sanctuary of sophistication and comfort. It is one of the key parts of the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained, as it has a meticulous design for the finest SUV lovers. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a Skyroof and soft-touch leatherette on the door trims and dashboard. Furthermore, the car has premium leatherette seats, a cooled glovebox with illumination, and a passive keyless entry. It also features a front armrest with storage and a console with a cup holder for a comfortable drive. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Interior 3. Smart Connectivity Another key Mahindra XUV 3XO configuration is its smart connectivity and technology. The car comes with a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system to make your drive enjoyable. In addition, the sound system lets you experience sonic expanse, and the bass enhancer technology uplifts your mood while driving in crowded areas. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a high-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation and has built-in Amazon Alexa for entertainment. Moreover, with the ADRENOX Connect technology, you can control your cars features through your smartphone from the comfort of your home. Feature and power packed compact SUV Mahindra XUV 3XO review - Feature and power packed compact SUV Out goes the Mahindra XUV300 and in comes the XUV 3XO. The new name is just the starting point of a very comprehensive upgrade. Updated on May 02, 2024 05:35:55 PM 87,049 Views Follow us on The XUV 3XO's styling is big on flash The diamond-shaped detailing on the lights and grille are a nice touch. The infotainment is now a 10.25-inch unit and works well. By Nikhil Bhatia Share - Make : Mahindra Model : XUV 3XO We Like Upmarket interior Strong engines Long equipment list We Don't Like Boot space Competent as the Mahindra XUV300 was, it never quite made it to the list of compact SUV bestsellers. Mahindra is now gunning for glory with the updated XUV300, christened the XUV 3XO. Mind you, this is no run-of-the-mill nip and tuck update. Mahindra has gone all out with a new look, redone interior, some class-first feature introductions, some class-best specifications and very enticing pricing. The aim is to take the fight to the Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza, Kia Sonet and Hyundai Venue, and win. Mahindra XUV 3XO: design and styling Where the XUV300s styling was understated, the XUV 3XO is big on flash. Giving the 3XO its distinctive face are the large, new vertically oriented headlights outlined by C-shaped DRLs (a link to the larger XUV700). The headlights are split into two sections with a concealed projector unit up top, and an open projector fog lamp unit lower down, both set amidst a black surround. The lights flank the new grille, which is actually a gloss panel that runs much of the XUVs width. The new front bumper with its pronounced cuts and creases is very concept car-like and the newly contoured bonnet also does its bit to add volume to the design. New C-shaped LED DRLs provide a visual link with the larger XUV700. Like the XUV300, the 3XO looks muscular in profile, and furthering the impression are the stylish new 17-inch diamond cut alloy wheels that are the largest in the segment. Theres also chunkier side cladding with cuts at the wheel arches. Mahindra says ground clearance is a generous 201mm, up from the XUV300s figure of 180mm. Mahindra XUV 3XO Price, Mileage, Specifications, Features and Variants Brand Mahindra Model Name XUV 3XO Mahindra XUV 3XO Price 9.06 - 18.39 lakh Mahindra XUV 3XO Range/Mileage Petrol : 17.96 - 20.1kpl | Diesel : 20.6 - 21.2kpl Mahindra XUV 3XO Specifications SUV | 5 doors | 5 seats View All Specs Mahindra XUV 3XO Features LED headlight | 10.25-inch Touchscreen display | 6 airbags View All Features Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants MX1 1.2 Petrol MT | REVX M 1.2 Petrol MT | REVX M (O) 1.2 Petrol MT View All Variants In its basic shape though, the 3XO is no different than the XUV300. The 2,600mm wheelbase remains class best, but the short overhangs, particularly at the back, tell you that this is a vehicle that's brutally shortened (remember it started life as a SsangYong Tivoli) to get length under the critical 4m mark, needed to qualify as a small car and hence a lower rate of tax. Quick Highlights Mahindra XUV 3XO REVX range launched from Rs 8.94 lakh (ex-showroom) Sports a body-coloured grille, black wheels, black leatherette seats and REVX badging Makes certain premium features like panoramic sunroof more accessible REVX M variants are positioned between the MX2 and MX2 Pro trims REVX A trims are positioned between the AX5 and AX5 L variants The REVX M comes with the entry-level MPFI engine, while the REVX A gets the TGDi engine Mahindra has just introduced a new range of variants for the XUV 3XO , called the REVX. The REVX range further branches into three variants, called the REVX M, REVX M (O) and REVX A. These variants basically add minor styling tweaks and make the premium top-end features more accessible, giving buyers more value for money. Heres a look at their pricing: Variant Price (ex-showroom) REVX M MPFI Manual Rs 8.94 lakh REVX M (O) MPFI Petrol Manual Rs 9.44 lakh REVX A TGDi Petrol Manual Rs 11.79 lakh REVX A TGDi Petrol Automatic Rs 12.99 lakh REVX M And M (O) The REVX M trim is essentially positioned between the MX2 and MX2 Pro trims, while the M (O) adds a crowd-favourite feature. The REVX version of the XUV 3XO gets REVX badging on the outside, black wheels and a body-coloured grille. The REVX M comes with black leatherette seats, which are otherwise available only with the AX7 variants. You get black wheel covers, a 10.25-inch infotainment, 4 speakers, steering-mounted audio controls, keyless entry, and height-adjustable driver seats. The REVX M (O) further introduces a single-pane sunroof. Both variants can be had only with the entry-level 1.2-litre MPFI engine, which makes 111 PS and 200 Nm, and can be opted for only with a 6-speed manual transmission. It misses out on the diesel option and the convenience of an automatic unit. REVX A The REVX A sits between the AX5 and AX5 L trims. Over the AX5 variant, it gets amenities like a panoramic sunroof, black leatherette seats, dual tone roof, black alloy wheels, auto dimming IRVM and body-coloured grille. It misses out on ADAS, a 360-degree camera, EPB with auto hold and a cooled glove box, which the AX5 L offers. Overall, it provides a different appearance with the black alloy wheels, tweaked grille, and black seats inside. Also, it comes with a panoramic sunroof, making the crowd-favourite feature more accessible. Bad news for diesel buyers, as this variant can only be had with the top-spec turbo-petrol engine. The engine here is a 1.2-litre TGDi petrol unit which makes 130 PS and 230 Nm. The good thing is that it can be had with both a 6-speed manual and a 6-speed automatic transmission. The REVX range can be opted for from 6 dual-tone hues: Tango Red, Nebula Blue, Stealth Black, Everest White and Galaxy Grey. Visually, the REVX range also comes with a body-coloured front grille as well, where the Galaxy Grey gets a Stealth Black grille. ZigSays The REVX range provides buyers with what they want! The demand for black seats, black alloy wheels and a sunroof at a more affordable price was always there, and Mahindra has offered that with the new variants. Team Spinny Last updated 3 months ago As we all know the safety of a vehicle is one of the most important attributes in current times. People want a car that not only delivers on performance and efficiency but also stands out with its safety features. The Mahindra XUV 3XO is making headlines as one of the safest small SUVs in India. This beast by Mahindra has gained attention for its advanced features and design, which are further complemented with its safety features. It is an upgraded version of the Mahindra XUV300 that packs a strong punch. The starting price of the Mahindra XUV 3XO is Rs. 7.99 lakh (ex-showroom), making it an affordable yet well-equipped compact SUV. The safety of a vehicle is best measured through crash test ratings, and Mahindra has ensured that the XUV 3XO meets high standards. The Mahindra XUV 3XO safety rating proves that it is one of the safest cars in its segment. Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP Safety Rating Checking a cars NCAP rating is one of the best ways to understand how safe it is. NCAP, or the New Car Assessment Program, conducts crash tests to see how well a vehicle can protect its occupants in an accident. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has performed well in its NCAP tests. It was tested under Bharat NCAP (BNCAP), which is Indias version of the global safety program. The Mahindra XUV 3XO received a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP, meaning it provides excellent protection for both adults and children. Lets look at the details of the Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP rating. Mahindra XUV 3XO Adult Occupant Protection Rating During the adult occupants rating in the NCAP test, the Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP ratings were pretty impressive. The vehicle scored the maximum possible score of 29.36 out of 32 points . Some crucial factors that contributed to this high rating include: Stable Bodyshell: The structure of the Mahindra XUV 3XO has been found to be stable, meaning it can withstand additional impact without collapsing. Frontal Impact Protection: The cars front airbags and seatbelt pre-tensioners helped reduce injuries to the head, neck, and chest. Side Impact Protection: The side structure of the XUV 3XO, along with additional side and curtain airbags, ensured safety in side collisions. Electronic Stability Control (ESC): This system helps maintain control of the car during sudden turns or slippery conditions, reducing the chances of rollovers. All-Wheel Disc Brakes: The XUV 3XO offers disc brakes on all four wheels, providing better braking efficiency. Mahindra XUV 3XO Child Occupant Protection Rating Child safety is another critical aspect of a cars overall safety rating. The Mahindra XUV 3XO safety rating for child occupants is 43 out of 49 points , which is an excellent score. This means the car provides solid protection for children in case of an accident. Some of the key factors that contributed to this rating include: ISOFIX Child Seat Anchors: These allow parents to securely install child safety seats, reducing the risk of movement in case of impact. final_report.summary: The Mahindra XUV 3XO prioritizes safety with a 5-star Bharat NCAP rating, 6 airbags, ESC, all-wheel disc brakes, and Level 2 ADAS features. These technologies collectively enhance occupant protection and accident prevention.
final_report.detailed:
Let me think through this: The Mahindra XUV 3XO has made safety a paramount concern in its design and feature set, positioning itself as a strong contender in the compact SUV segment. A comprehensive analysis reveals a multi-faceted approach to safety, encompassing both passive and active safety systems, along with advanced driver-assistance technologies. The XUV 3XO's commitment to safety is validated by its 5-star safety rating from Bharat NCAP, demonstrating its ability to protect occupants in the event of a collision.

**Passive Safety Features:**

Passive safety features are designed to minimize injury during a crash. The XUV 3XO incorporates several key passive safety elements:

*   **6 Airbags:** The XUV 3XO comes standard with up to 6 airbags, including front, side, and curtain airbags. These airbags provide a cushioning effect during a collision, reducing the risk of head, chest, and pelvic injuries. Airbags are strategically positioned to offer comprehensive protection to all occupants.

    *   **Benefits:** Significantly reduces the severity of injuries in frontal and side-impact collisions. Provides crucial head protection, minimizing the risk of trauma.

    *   **Effectiveness:** Airbags are most effective when used in conjunction with seatbelts. Studies have shown that airbags reduce driver fatalities in frontal crashes by approximately 30%.
*   **Robust Built and Structural Integrity:** The vehicle's body structure is designed to absorb and distribute impact forces away from the passenger cabin. High-strength steel is used in critical areas to enhance structural rigidity and crashworthiness.

    *   **Benefits:** Maintains the integrity of the passenger compartment during a collision, preventing intrusion and reducing the risk of injury. Provides a stable foundation for the deployment of other safety systems.

    *   **Effectiveness:** A stable bodyshell is essential for achieving high crash test ratings. It ensures that the airbags and seatbelts can function optimally.
*   **Seatbelt Reminders for All Occupants:** The XUV 3XO includes seatbelt reminders for all seats, prompting occupants to buckle up. This feature helps ensure that all occupants are properly restrained in the event of a crash.

    *   **Benefits:** Increases seatbelt usage, which is the most effective way to prevent serious injuries in a collision.

    *   **Effectiveness:** Seatbelts reduce the risk of fatal injury to front-seat occupants by up to 50% and to rear-seat occupants by up to 25%.

**Active Safety Features:**

Active safety features are designed to prevent accidents from occurring in the first place. The XUV 3XO is equipped with several advanced active safety systems:

*   **Electronic Stability Control (ESC) with Hill Hold Control (HHC):** ESC helps maintain vehicle stability by detecting and reducing skidding. HHC prevents the vehicle from rolling backward on inclines.

    *   **Benefits:** Enhances vehicle control in adverse driving conditions, such as slippery roads or sudden maneuvers. Prevents roll-away accidents on hills.

    *   **Effectiveness:** ESC has been shown to reduce single-vehicle crashes by up to 30%. HHC provides added safety and convenience on steep inclines.
*   **Anti-lock Braking System (ABS) with Electronic Brake-force Distribution (EBD):** ABS prevents the wheels from locking up during braking, allowing the driver to maintain steering control. EBD distributes braking force optimally between the front and rear wheels.

    *   **Benefits:** Improves braking performance and reduces stopping distances, especially on slippery surfaces. Enhances steering control during emergency braking.

    *   **Effectiveness:** ABS has been shown to reduce the risk of crashes by approximately 10%. EBD optimizes braking efficiency, further improving safety.
*   **All-Wheel Disc Brakes:** The XUV 3XO features disc brakes on all four wheels, providing consistent and reliable braking performance.

    *   **Benefits:** Offers superior braking power compared to drum brakes, especially in wet conditions. Reduces brake fade and improves overall braking performance.

    *   **Effectiveness:** Disc brakes provide more consistent and predictable braking performance, enhancing safety in various driving conditions.
*   **Tyre Pressure Monitoring System (TPMS):** TPMS monitors the air pressure in each tire and alerts the driver if the pressure drops below a certain threshold.

    *   **Benefits:** Prevents tire blowouts, improves fuel efficiency, and extends tire life. Enhances vehicle stability and handling.

    *   **Effectiveness:** TPMS helps drivers maintain optimal tire pressure, reducing the risk of accidents caused by underinflated tires.

**Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS):**

The XUV 3XO is equipped with Level 2 ADAS, offering a suite of advanced driver assistance technologies:

*   **Adaptive Cruise Control:** Automatically adjusts the vehicle's speed to maintain a safe distance from the vehicle ahead.

    *   **Benefits:** Reduces driver fatigue on long journeys and helps prevent rear-end collisions.

    *   **Effectiveness:** Adaptive cruise control can significantly reduce the risk of accidents in highway driving.
*   **Lane Keeping Assist:** Detects lane markings and provides steering assistance to help keep the vehicle within its lane.

    *   **Benefits:** Prevents unintentional lane departures and reduces the risk of side-impact collisions.

    *   **Effectiveness:** Lane keeping assist can significantly reduce the risk of lane departure accidents.
*   **Automatic Emergency Braking (AEB):** Detects potential collisions and automatically applies the brakes to mitigate or avoid the impact.

    *   **Benefits:** Reduces the severity of collisions and can prevent accidents altogether.

    *   **Effectiveness:** AEB is one of the most effective ADAS features, significantly reducing the risk of front-to-rear collisions.
*   **Blind Spot Monitoring:** Alerts the driver to the presence of vehicles in their blind spots.

    *   **Benefits:** Prevents lane-change accidents.

    *   **Effectiveness:** Blind spot monitoring enhances awareness of surrounding traffic, minimizing the risk of collisions.

*   **360-Degree Surround View System with Blind View Monitor:** Provides a comprehensive view of the vehicle's surroundings, aiding in parking and low-speed maneuvers.

    *   **Benefits:** Enhances visibility and reduces the risk of collisions in tight spaces.

    *   **Effectiveness:** The 360-degree camera improves driver awareness and reduces the likelihood of parking-related accidents.

**Safety Certifications and Ratings:**

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has earned a 5-star safety rating from Bharat NCAP, which confirms its ability to protect adult and child occupants in a crash. Bharat NCAP subjects vehicles to a series of crash tests, including frontal impact, side impact, and pole impact tests, to evaluate their crashworthiness. The XUV 3XO's 5-star rating demonstrates that it meets the highest safety standards.

**Effectiveness Analysis:**

The effectiveness of the XUV 3XO's safety features has been proven through crash tests and real-world data analysis. The 5-star Bharat NCAP rating indicates that the vehicle provides excellent protection for occupants in a variety of crash scenarios. The ADAS features have also been shown to reduce the risk of accidents in real-world driving conditions. For example, AEB has been shown to reduce front-to-rear collisions by up to 50%.

**Conclusion:**

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a safe and well-equipped compact SUV that prioritizes the safety of its occupants. Its combination of passive and active safety features, along with advanced driver assistance systems, makes it one of the safest vehicles in its class. The 5-star Bharat NCAP rating further validates its commitment to safety. Mahindra has successfully integrated a comprehensive suite of safety technologies into the XUV 3XO, offering a safe and secure driving experience for all occupants.
